thread.title: Mariners outlast Schooners in low-scoring OT playoff
thread.title_full: Mariners outlast Schooners in low-scoring OT playoff

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Mariners outlast Schooners in low-scoring OT playoff
text:
View More... 
Rockland â€” One-hundred and 46 minutes and 28 seconds. 
That is how long it took for fans of the Oceanside and Camden-Rockport middle school field hockey teams to hear the all-important bang on the back of the cage through two recent games between the Knox County rivals. 
For the No. 4 Mariners, who hosted the No. 5 Schooners at Oceanside East in a Busline League prelim playoff game, it proved worth the wait. 
Erin Corcoran got her stick on the ball in front of the cage amid a scrum, off a pass from Sophia Campbell, and pushed the ball past the Schooner keeper with 5:34 left in the second overtime as Oceanside celebrated a hard-fought 1-0 postseason victory. 
A link to more photos from this playoff game will appear later with this story. 
Click for photos from the previous game between the teams. 
Middle school field hockey games consist of two 30-minute halves, and, if necessary, two eight-minute overtime periods. The squads had played to a scoreless tie the last time they met during the regular season. 
With Wednesday's playoff win, Oceanside advances to the semifinal round, where it will face No. 1 and defending champion Troy Howard of Belfast on Thursday, Oct. 15 at 3:45 p.m. 
The winner of that game will advance to the league championship on Monday, Oct. 19 at Boothbay Region Elementary School, where it will face the survivor of the other semifinal playoff match between No. 2 Boothbay and No. 3 Great Salt Bay of Damariscotta. 
On Wednesday in Rockland, Alexa Barstow played in the cage for Oceanside, while Anunthaya Macdonnell played in goal for Camden-Rockport. 
Team members for Oceanside include Audrey Young, Hannah Simmons, Sophia Campbell, Amanda Frost, Julie Sprayberry, Marina Lamkins, Jade Phillip, Maggie Tinker, Julia Bartlett, Alexa Barstow, Erin Corcoran, Cadence Lamkins, Mareh Willis, Erin Stevenson, Maria Protheroe, Quincie Flynn, Emma Gerrish, Anna Campbell, Cassi Evans, Grace Young, Seanna Montgomery and Chloe Simmons. The team is coached by Andrea Garver. 
Team members for Camden-Rockport include Greta Bishop, Alyssa Bland, Annika Charland, Gail Curtis, Greta Curtis, Sage Curtis, Lillian Dailey, Charlotte Hood, Lyra Kalajian, Alison Linares-Mendoza, Meredith Luce, Anunthaya MacDonnell, Kennedy Peterson, Rachael Rademacher, Lillia Stone, Phoebe Walsh, Kathryn Desrosiers and Molly McClellan. The team is coached by Matthew Smith.
